up.bus.name: up.bus
up.bus.description:
Event bus for up-related events:
  
- `app:ready`
- `fragment:ready` with arguments `($fragment)`
- `fragment:destroy` with arguments `($fragment)`
  
TODO: This might eventually be rolled into regular document events.

up.navigation.name: up.navigation
up.navigation.description:
This module marks up link elements with classes indicating that
they are currently loading (class `up-active`) or linking
to the current location (class `up-current`).
  
The current location is either:
  
- the URL displayed in the browser window's location bar
- the source URL of a currently opened {{#crossLink "up.modal"}}modal dialog{{/crossLink}} 
- the source URL of a currently opened {{#crossLink "up.popup"}}popup overlay{{/crossLink}}

up.popup.name: up.popup
up.popup.description:
Pop-up overlays.
  
For modal dialogs see {{#crossLink "up.modal"}}{{/crossLink}}.

up.util.name: up.util
up.util.description:
Utility functions.
  
All methods in this module are for internal use by the Up.js framework
and will frequently change between releases.

classitems.description:
Makes a snapshot of the currently registered bus listeners,
to later be restored through {{#crossLink "up.bus/up.bus.reset"}}{{/crossLink}}
classitems.name: up.bus.snapshot

classitems.description:
Resets the list of registered event listeners to the
moment when the framework was booted.
classitems.name: up.bus.reset

classitems.description:
Registers an event handler to be called when the given
event is triggered.
classitems.name: up.bus.listen

params.name: eventName
params.description: The event name to match.

params.name: handler
params.description: The event handler to be called with the event arguments.

classitems.description: Triggers an event.
classitems.name: up.bus.emit

params.name: eventName
params.description: The name of the event.

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments that describe the event.

classitems.description:
Replaces elements on the current page with corresponding elements
from a new page fetched from the server.

The current and new elements must have the same CSS selector.
classitems.name: up.replace

params.name: selectorOrElement
params.description:
The CSS selector to update. You can also pass a DOM element or jQuery element
  here, in which case a selector will be inferred from the element's class and ID.

params.name: url
params.description: The URL to fetch from the server.

params.name: options.history
params.description:
If a `String` is given, it is used as the URL the browser's location bar and history.
  If omitted or true, the `url` argument will be used.
  If set to `false`, the history will remain unchanged.

classitems.description: Replaces the given selector with the same selector from the given HTML string.
classitems.name: up.flow.implant

params.name: {String]
params.description: [options.history]

params.name: {String]
params.description: [options.historyMethod='push']

classitems.description:
Destroys the given element or selector.
Takes care that all destructors, if any, are called.
classitems.name: up.destroy

classitems.description:
Replaces the given selector or element with a fresh copy
fetched from the server.
classitems.name: up.reload

classitems.description:
Resets Up.js to the state when it was booted.
All custom event handlers, animations, etc. that have been registered
will be discarded.

This is an internal method for to enable unit testing.
Don't use this in production.
classitems.name: up.reset

classitems.description: Submits a form using the Up.js flow.
classitems.name: up.submit

params.name: formOrSelector
params.description:
A reference or selector for the form to submit.
  If the argument points to an element that is not a form,
  Up.js will search its ancestors for the closest form.

params.name: options.history
params.description:
Successful form submissions will add a history entry and change the browser's
  location bar if the form either uses the `GET` method or the response redirected
  to another page (this requires the `upjs-rails` gem).
  If want to prevent history changes in any case, set this to `false`.
  If you pass a `String`, it is used as the URL for the browser history.

return.description: A promise for the AJAX response

classitems.description:
Observes an input field by periodic polling its value.
Executes code when the value changes.

This is useful for observing text fields while the user is typing,
since browsers will only fire a `change` event once the user
blurs the text field.
classitems.name: up.observe

params.name: options.change
params.description:
The callback to execute when the field's value changes.
  If given as a function, it must take two arguments (`value`, `$field`).
  If given as a string, it will be evaled as Javascript code in a context where
  (`value`, `$field`) are set.

classitems.description:
Visits the given URL without a full page load.
This is done by fetching `url` through an AJAX request
and replacing the current `<body>` tag with the response's `<body>` tag..
classitems.name: up.visit

params.name: url
params.description: The URL to visit.

params.name: options
params.description: See options for {{#crossLink "up.flow/up.replace"}}{{/crossLink}}.

classitems.description:
Follows the given link and replaces a selector in the current page
with corresponding elements from a new page fetched from the server.
classitems.name: up.follow

params.name: link
params.description:
An element or selector which resolves to an `<a>` tag
  or any element that is marked up with an `up-follow` attribute.

params.name: options.target
params.description:
The selector to replace.
  Defaults to the `up-target` attribute on `link`,
  or to `body` if such an attribute does not exist.

params.name: options.transition
params.description: A transition function or name.

classitems.description:
Binds an event handler to the document,
which will be executed whenever the given event
is triggered on the given selector.
classitems.name: up.on

params.name: events
params.description: A space-separated list of event names to bind.

params.name: selector
params.description: The selector an on which the event must be triggered.

params.name: behavior
params.description: The handler that should be called.

classitems.description:
Registers a function to be called whenever an element with
the given selector is inserted into the DOM through Up.js.
classitems.name: up.awaken

params.name: selector
params.description: The selector to match.

params.name: awakener
params.description:
The function to call when a matching element is inserted.
  The function takes the new element as the first argument (as a jQuery object).
  It may return another function that destroys the awakened
  object when it is removed from the DOM, by clearing global state such as
  time-outs and event handlers bound to the document.

classitems.description:
Makes a snapshot of the currently registered event listeners,
to later be restored through {{#crossLink "up.magic/up.magic.reset"}}{{/crossLink}}
classitems.name: up.magic.snapshot

classitems.description:
Resets the list of registered event listeners to the
moment when the framework was booted.
classitems.name: up.magic.reset

classitems.description: Opens a modal overlay.
classitems.name: up.modal.open

params.name: options.sticky
params.description:
If set to `true`, the modal remains
  open even if the page changes in the background.

classitems.description:
Returns the source URL for the fragment displayed
in the current modal overlay, or `undefined` if no
modal is open.
classitems.name: up.modal.source

classitems.description:
Closes a currently opened modal overlay.
Does nothing if no modal is currently open.
classitems.name: up.modal.close

params.name: options
params.description: See options for {{#crossLink "up.motion/up.animate"}}{{/crossLink}}.

classitems.description:
Animates an element.

The following animations are pre-registered:

- `fade-in`
- `fade-out`
- `move-to-top`
- `move-from-top`
- `move-to-bottom`
- `move-from-bottom`
- `move-to-left`
- `move-from-left`
- `move-to-right`
- `move-from-right`
- `none`
classitems.name: up.animate

return.description: A promise for the animation's end.

classitems.description:
Performs a transition between two elements.

The following transitions  are pre-registered:

- `cross-fade`
- `move-top`
- `move-bottom`
- `move-left`
- `move-right`
- `none`

You can also compose a transition from two animation names
separated by a slash character (`/`):

- `move-to-bottom/fade-in`
- `move-to-left/move-from-top`
classitems.name: up.morph

return.description: A promise for the transition's end.

classitems.description: Defines a named transition.
classitems.name: up.transition

classitems.description: Defines a named animation.
classitems.name: up.animation

classitems.description:
Returns a no-op animation or transition which has no visual effects
and completes instantly.
classitems.name: up.motion.none

classitems.description: Opens a popup overlay.
classitems.name: up.popup.open

params.name: options.sticky
params.description:
If set to `true`, the popup remains
  open even if the page changes in the background.

classitems.description:
Returns the source URL for the fragment displayed
in the current popup overlay, or `undefined` if no
popup is open.
classitems.name: up.popup.source

classitems.description:
Closes a currently opened popup overlay.
Does nothing if no popup is currently open.
classitems.name: up.popup.close

params.name: options
params.description: See options for {{#crossLink "up.motion/up.animate"}}{{/crossLink}}.

classitems.description:
When an element with this attribute is clicked,
a currently open popup is closed.
classitems.name: [up-close]

classitems.description: Opens a tooltip.
classitems.name: up.tooltip.open

classitems.description:
Closes a currently shown tooltip.
Does nothing if no tooltip is currently shown.
classitems.name: up.tooltip.close

params.name: options
params.description: See options for {{#crossLink "up.motion/up.animate"}}{{/crossLink}}.

classitems.description:
Normalizes URLs, relative paths and absolute paths to a full URL
that can be checked for equality with other normalized URL.

By default hashes are ignored, search queries are included.
classitems.name: up.util.normalizeUrl

classitems.description:
Returns the first argument that is considered present.
If an argument is a function, it is called and the value is checked for presence.

This function is useful when you have multiple option sources and the value can be boolean.
In that case you cannot change the sources with a `||` operator
(since that doesn't short-circuit at `false`).
classitems.name: up.util.option

classitems.description: Animates the given element's CSS properties using CSS transitions.
classitems.name: up.util.cssAnimate

params.name: elementOrSelector
params.description: The element to animate.

params.name: lastFrame
params.description: The CSS properties that should be transitioned to.

params.name: opts.duration
params.description: The duration of the animation, in milliseconds.

params.name: opts.delay
params.description: The delay before the animation starts, in milliseconds.

params.name:
[opts.easing='ease']
  The timing function that controls the animation's acceleration.
  See [W3C documentation]
params.description:
(http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-transitions/#transition-timing-function)
  for a list of pre-defined timing functions.

return.description: A promise for the animation's end.
